intro: Hebe traversii, commonly known as the Southern Alps hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple, typically blooming in spring. Hebe traversii thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its ornamental value and hardiness contribute to its cultivation in temperate climates.
